main.gol.model.boards

Class DynamicBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.gol.model.boards.DynamicBoard

  • public class DynamicBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all the Board logic and its Cells which represents the Grid.
    See Also:
    Cell

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DynamicBoard(int rows, int columns)
      This constructor constructs a new DynamicBoard with given number of rows and columns.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearBoard()
      This method iterates through the grid and sets all living cells to dead/false
      int countNeighbours(int x, int y)
      This method takes a cell's x/y coordinates as inputParameter and checks the cell for surrounding alive neighbors then returns the amount as an int.
      int getAliveCells()
      Counts the alive cells for this board
      Cell getCell(int x, int y)
      This method returns a cell based on x/y coordinates.
      java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getGeneration()
      Returns the next generation of alive cells.
      java.util.List<java.util.List<Cell>> getGrid()
      Returns the grid.
      void nextGeneration()
      This method populates the next generation of cells in a generation list.
      void randomize()
      This method generates a random set of alive cells and adds them to the generation list.
      void setBoard(byte[][] board)
      This method initializes a board based on a byte[][] board array containing values with both live and dead cells.
      void setBoard(int columns, int rows)
      This method initializes a board based on width/height (columns/rows) with false values(Dead cells).
      void setCellState(int x, int y, boolean state)
      This method sets a new cell outside the arrayIndex bounds by expanding the grid and filling the empty slots in the ArrayList.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Method for testing purposes.

    • Method Detail

      • setCellState

        public void setCellState(int x,
                         int y,
                         boolean state)
        This method sets a new cell outside the arrayIndex bounds by expanding the grid and filling the empty slots in the ArrayList. Board expansion is enabled but not implemented, due to nick of time for the project deadline .
        Parameters:
        x - int
        y - int
        state - boolean

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(int columns,
                     int rows)
        This method initializes a board based on width/height (columns/rows) with false values(Dead cells).
        Parameters:
        columns - int
        rows - int

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(byte[][] board)
        This method initializes a board based on a byte[][] board array containing values with both live and dead cells.
        Parameters:
        board - byte[][]

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int x,
                    int y)
        This method returns a cell based on x/y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - int
        y - int
        Returns:
        Cell

      • nextGeneration

        public void nextGeneration()
        This method populates the next generation of cells in a generation list. Checks each cell for its state, then checks each neighbors state and counts surrounding live cells, then finally collects the next generation of cells in an ArrayList.

      • randomize

        public void randomize()
        This method generates a random set of alive cells and adds them to the generation list.

      • clearBoard

        public void clearBoard()
        This method iterates through the grid and sets all living cells to dead/false

      • getGrid

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<Cell>> getGrid()
        Returns the grid.
        Returns:
        List

      • getGeneration

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getGeneration()
        Returns the next generation of alive cells.
        Returns:
        ArrayList drawGeneration

      • countNeighbours

        public int countNeighbours(int x,
                           int y)
        This method takes a cell's x/y coordinates as inputParameter and checks the cell for surrounding alive neighbors then returns the amount as an int.
        Parameters:
        x - int
        y - int

      • getAliveCells

        public int getAliveCells()
        Counts the alive cells for this board
        Returns:
        the number of alive cells

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method for testing purposes. This method returns a serialized string of the initialized gameBoard describing each cell's state. e.g."0010100101010"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
